definition: to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

sentences.english: This afternoon Tietz declared the letter to be a forgery.
sentences.chinese: 当天下午Tietz声明信件是伪造的。

sentences.english: Facebook insists that the emails and contract are fabricated. In an email to Mashable a Facebook representative said
sentences.chinese: 坚持认为电子邮件和合同是伪造的。

sentences.english: The third part explores the legal system of indorsement forgery.
sentences.chinese: 本文第三部分探讨了背书伪造法律制度。

sentences.english: You don't publish results that you've faked.
sentences.chinese: 你不用发表你伪造的结果。

sentences.english: The problem is, mail servers can't tell the difference between a spurious request and a real request.
sentences.chinese: 问题在于，邮件服务器无法区分伪造请求和真实请求。

sentences.english: Research on problem of data redundancy in wide area sensor databases;
sentences.chinese: 该方案具有强不可伪造性，且签名结果不含冗余数据。

sentences.english: I must take some counterfeit nourishment.
The new credit cards have many features which are designed to thwart forgers .
sentences.chinese: 新的信用卡有许多特征，是设计用来防止伪造的。

sentences.english: He was arrested since he had violate forged crime.
sentences.chinese: 他因犯伪造罪而被拘捕。

sentences.english: It is a crime to counterfeit money.
" Eisenman states categorically that he believes the James "artifact" is a forgery.
sentences.chinese: 埃森曼说他绝对地相信雅各“手工艺品”是一种伪造。

sentences.english: Forgers have many ways to make their work look real.
sentences.chinese: 伪造有很多方式，使他们的工作，看看真实的。

sentences.english: That is no doubt true for the backstreet forgers around MacArthur Park.
sentences.chinese: 麦克阿瑟地区的伪造者也会因此而无法伪造。

sentences.english: That is no doubt true for the backstreet forgers around MacArthur Park.
sentences.chinese: 麦克阿瑟地区的伪造者也会因此而无法伪造。

definition: to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to assume sb's name and take his place (idiom); to impersonate/to pose under a false name
to impersonate/to pose as (someone else)/to counterfeit/to palm off (a fake as a genuine)
to counterfeit/to falsify/to cheat/to defraud/fraudulent/to behave affectedly
to feign/to pretend to be/to pass oneself off as
